Rulers of Chotanagpur

The Nagvanshi dynasty ruled the Chotanagpur plateau (Jharkhand) for centuries. According to legends, it was founded in the first century by Phani Mukut Rai. They considered themselves descendants of the mythical Nagas (serpents). Their initial capital was Sutiambe.

ЁЯП░
Navratangarh and Mughal Contact

Raja Durjan Sal (17th century) was a prominent ruler. He was imprisoned by Jahangir in Gwalior Fort because he was skilled in identifying diamonds (the Kokra region was known for diamonds). After his release, he built a magnificent palace at Navratangarh (Doisagarh), which shows glimpses of Mughal architecture like Jharokha Darshan.

ЁЯП╣
Colonial Period

With the arrival of the British, the Nagvanshi rulers became zamindars, but their local influence persisted. They were known for preserving tribal culture and traditions.
